verses.text_plain: Give unto the Lord, O ye mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength.
verses.verse_html:
1Give unto the Lord, O ye mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength. ▼
▼ ye mighty: Heb. ye sons of the mighty

tokens.definition: יָהַב yâhab, yaw-hab'; a primitive root; to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come:—ascribe, bring, come on, give, go, set, take.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: give (23x), go to (4x), Bring (2x), ascribe (1x), come on (1x), give out (1x), Set (1x), take (1x).
outline: to give, provide, ascribe, come (Qal) to give to set, place to provide (with reflexive) to ascribe (glory) to grant, permit, come now
(Qal) to give to set, place to provide (with reflexive) to ascribe (glory) to grant, permit, come now

verses.text_plain: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.
verses.verse_html:
2Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness. ▼
▼ the glory…: Heb. the honour of his name
 , ▼
▼ in…: or, in his glorious sanctuary

tokens.definition: שֵׁם shêm, shame; a primitive word [perhaps rather from H7760 through the idea of definite and conspicuous position; compare H8064 ]; an appellation, as a mark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character:— + base, (in-) fame(-ous), named(-d), renown, report.

outline: name name reputation, fame, glory the Name (as designation of God) memorial, monument

tokens.definition: שָׁחָה shâchâh, shaw-khaw'; a primitive root; to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God):—bow (self) down, crouch, fall down (flat), humbly beseech, do (make) obeisance, do reverence, make to stoop, worship.

verses.verse_html: 6He maketh them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young unicorn.

tokens.text: He maketh them also to skip
tokens.definition: רָקַד râqad, raw-kad'; a primitive root; properly, to stamp, i.e. to spring about (wildly or for joy):—dance, jump, leap, skip.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: dance (4x), skip (3x), leap (1x), jump (1x).
outline: to skip about (Qal) to skip about (Piel) to dance, leap (Hiphil) to make to skip

tokens.definition: עֵגֶל ʻêgel, ay-ghel; from the same as H5696 ; a (male) calf (as frisking round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a steer):—bullock, calf.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: calf (33x), bullock (2x).

tokens.definition: לְבָנוֹן Lᵉbânôwn, leb-aw-nohn'; from H3825 ; (the) white mountain (from its snow); Lebanon, a mountain range in Palestine:—Lebanon.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Lebanon (71x).
outline: Lebanon = "whiteness" a wooded mountain range on the northern border of Israel
a wooded mountain range on the northern border of Israel

tokens.pos: proper noun with reference to a mountain
tokens.definition: שִׁרְיוֹן Shiryôwn, shir-yone'; and שִׂרְיֹן Siryôn; the same as H8302 (i.e. sheeted with snow); Shirjon or Sirjon, a peak of the Lebanon:—Sirion.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Sirion (2x).
outline: Sirion = "breastplate" one of the names of Mount Hermon this one used by the Sidonians
one of the names of Mount Hermon this one used by the Sidonians

tokens.definition: רְאֵם rᵉʼêm, reh-ame'; or רְאֵים rᵉʼêym, reh-ame';or רֵים rêym, rame; or רֵם rêm, rame; from H7213 ; a wild bull (from its conspicuousness):—unicorn.

tokens.definition: חוּל chûwl, khool; or חִיל chîyl; a primitive root; properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert:—bear, (make to) bring forth, (make to) calve, dance, drive away, fall grievously (with pain), fear, form, great, grieve, (be) grievous, hope, look, make, be in pain, be much (sore) pained, rest, shake, shapen, (be) sorrow(-ful), stay, tarry, travail (with pain), tremble, trust, wait carefully (patiently), be wounded.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: pain (6x), formed (5x), bring forth (4x), pained (4x), tremble (4x), travail (4x), dance (2x), calve (2x), grieved (2x), grievous (2x), wounded (2x), shake (2x), miscellaneous (23x).
outline: to twist, whirl, dance, writhe, fear, tremble, travail, be in anguish, be pained (Qal) to dance to twist, writhe to whirl, whirl about (Polel) to dance to writhe (in travail with), bear, bring forth to wait anxiously (Pulal) to be made to writhe, be made to bear to be brought forth (Hophal) to be born (Hithpolel) whirling (participle) writhing, suffering torture (participle) to wait longingly (Hithpalpel) to be distressed

to writhe (in travail with), bear, bring forth

to be made to writhe, be made to bear

tokens.definition: מַבּוּל mabbûwl, mab-bool'; from H2986 in the sense of flowing; a deluge:—flood.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: flood (13x).
outline: flood, deluge. Noah's flood that submerged the entire planet earth under water for about a year Some think Noah's flood was only local. However the description of it found in Gen 6-8 makes this patently absurd. If it were local, Noah had 120 years to migrate out of the area to safe ground! Why waste all that effort building a ship? He only had to move less than 1500 feet a day to reach the farthest point on the globe! With the possible exception of Psa 29:: 10, this word always refers to Noah's flood. The real reason for insisting on a local flood is the acceptance of evolution with its long geological ages. Most holding that view are not willing to allow a global world wide flood to have happened less than 5000 years ago. To admit such eliminates the need for the geological ages for most of the geological column would have be rapidly laid down by Noah's flood.

Noah's flood that submerged the entire planet earth under water for about a year Some think Noah's flood was only local. However the description of it found in Gen 6-8 makes this patently absurd. If it were local, Noah had 120 years to migrate out of the area to safe ground! Why waste all that effort building a ship? He only had to move less than 1500 feet a day to reach the farthest point on the globe! With the possible exception of Psa 29:: 10, this word always refers to Noah's flood. The real reason for insisting on a local flood is the acceptance of evolution with its long geological ages. Most holding that view are not willing to allow a global world wide flood to have happened less than 5000 years ago. To admit such eliminates the need for the geological ages for most of the geological column would have be rapidly laid down by Noah's flood.

outline: to dwell, remain, sit, abide (Qal) to sit, sit down to be set to remain, stay to dwell, have one's abode (Niphal) to be inhabited (Piel) to set, place (Hiphil) to cause to sit to cause to abide, set to cause to dwell to cause (cities) to be inhabited to marry (give an dwelling to) (Hophal) to be inhabited to make to dwell

(Hiphil) to cause to sit to cause to abide, set to cause to dwell to cause (cities) to be inhabited to marry (give an dwelling to)

tokens.definition: עוֹלָם ʻôwlâm, o-lawm'; or עֹלָם ʻôlâm; from H5956 ; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always:—alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world ( + without end). Compare H5331 , H5703 .
tokens.kjv_translation_count: ever (272x), everlasting (63x), old (22x), perpetual (22x), evermore (15x), never (13x), time (6x), ancient (5x), world (4x), always (3x), alway (2x), long (2x), more (2x), never (with H 408) (2x), miscellaneous (6x).
outline: long duration, antiquity, futurity, for ever, ever, everlasting, evermore, perpetual, old, ancient, world ancient time, long time (of past) (of future) for ever, always continuous existence, perpetual everlasting, indefinite or unending future, eternity

verses.text_plain: The Lord will give strength unto his people; the Lord will bless his people with peace.
verses.verse_html: 11The Lord will give strength unto his people; the Lord will bless his people with peace.

tokens.definition: יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh, yeh-ho-vaw'; from H1961 ; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jeho-vah, Jewish national name of God:—Jehovah, the Lord. Compare H3050 , H3069 .

tokens.definition: בָּרַךְ bârak, baw-rak'; a primitive root; to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason):— × abundantly, × altogether, × at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, × greatly, × indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, × still, thank.
